statement: A snake_case message ledger must be the source of truth for prompts/outputs/usage, while critic outputs remain stored in their associated domain tables (rubrics/scores) with message references for auditability.
rationale: Current schema couples domain tables to agent-kit threads; user requires a new messages table while keeping rubric/score critic outputs in their tables.
keyAssumptions: All provider responses can be normalized into a message schema usable for analysis exports.
validationCriteria: Schema plan introduces llm_messages + llm_requests and keeps rubric/score critic outputs in domain tables.
critiquePoints: Denormalization vs joins may impact export latency; needs careful endpoint design.
questions: Should message ledger store both raw and normalized payloads, or only normalized?
Do we need a separate llm_message_pairs view for user/assistant alignment?
